bug.short_desc: libgweather "Failed to get METAR data: 404 Not Found"
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1194967 METAR retrieval patch for 3.18.x
Description of problem:
Due to a shutdown of an old NOAA service at http://weather.noaa.gov/ libgweather is no longer able to retrieve weather data. See https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=770321 for more details, a discussion and a patch. That patch requires a minor adjustemt to be applicable for a library as used in F23.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): libgweather-3.18.1-1.fc23
Additional info: A patched library on F23 x86_64 restores a normal operation
Same on F24 and F25 pre-alpha compose (2016-08-27)

Alternatively, just update to the latest version released today: F23: 3.18.2 F24, F25, F26 (rawhide): 3.20.3
See upstream bug report https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=770321

I'm proposing this bug as Final Blocker since it violates section "Default application functionality" of Fedora final release criteria:¹
> "All applications that can be launched using the standard graphical mechanism of a release-blocking desktop after a default installation of that desktop must start successfully and withstand a basic functionality test. […]
IMHO basic functionality of gnome-weather includes showing weather for at least one user-selected location, which is not working right now.
¹ https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_25_Final_Release_Criteria#Default_application_functionality
libgweather-3.18.2-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1a0c6260d0
libgweather-3.20.3-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1e985ae9f6

Discussed during the 2016-08-29 blocker review meeting: [1]
The decision to classify this bug as an AcceptedBlocker was made as the bug causes gnome-weather to be unable to display any weather data, and as such is a violation of the following Final criteria:
"All applications that can be launched using the standard graphical mechanism of a release-blocking desktop after a default installation of that desktop must start successfully and withstand a basic functionality test"
[1] https://meetbot.fedoraproject.org/fedora-blocker-review/2016-08-29/f25-blocker-review.2016-08-29-16.00.txt

libgweather-3.18.2-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1a0c6260d0

libgweather-3.20.3-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1e985ae9f6
libgweather-3.20.3-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
